question_text: What is the purpose of a subnet mask in IPv4 addressing?
answer_options: To identify which part of the IP address is the host portion
To define the MAC address range allowed in a VLAN
To encrypt the address for secure routing
To map public to private addresses
correct_answer: To identify which part of the IP address is the host portion
explanation: The subnet mask defines how many bits of the address are used for the network portion and how many for the host portion.
